messages.message: @shaunak looks like `stat` is not a valid member of `clients.ibobject`. How can I call this from UDF?
@Nithin there should be a clients.ibfile that you can then invoke all the instabase ibfile functions on

@Jonathan Shih I used `clients.ibflie.stat(filename, api_args)`  from UDF. seeing below error.
```IBFile' object has no attribute 'stat'.```
I did `dir(clients.ibfile)` (results below) to see whether `stat`  is the right attribute. Looks like `stat` attribute is not present.
```['__class__', '__delattr__', '__dict__', '__dir__', '__doc__', '__eq__', '__format__', '__ge__', '__getattribute__', '__gt__', '__hash__', '__init__', '__init_subclass__', '__le__', '__lt__', '__module__', '__ne__', '__new__', '__reduce__', '__reduce_ex__', '__repr__', '__setattr__', '__sizeof__', '__str__', '__subclasshook__', '__weakref__', '_file_client', '_get_username', '_username', 'copy', 'exists', 'is_dir', 'is_file', 'list_dir', 'mkdir', 'open', 'read_file', 'rm', 'write_file']```
sad. what file are you trying to get the size of? is it the input file to the udf or just an arbitrary file on the filesystem?
I am looking to get size of both (input file to the UDF and also file on filesystem)
